Key Match Events: Scott Edwards hit a feisty half-century
Paul van Meekeren took four for 23
Bas de Leede got the key dismissal of Mehidy Hasan Miraz for 35
Edwards rode his luck to score a stroke-filled 68
Logan van Beek scored 23 not out
Shoriful Islam (two for 51) and Mahedi Hasan (two for 40) cleaned up the tail
Post-Match Reflections: Edwards said, 'I was speaking to a couple of guys and we were saying that if we could get 220 plus, we would be in the game... it was nice that the bottom order guys got us to what we thought was a pretty competitive total'
Edwards added, 'I thought that we were awesome with the ball and probably even more so on the field, where we had let ourselves down in the last few games.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Netherlands lost both of their openers in the first 14 balls
Wesley Barresi repaired the damage with a breezy 41
Colin Ackermann did not last much longer and the Dutch should have been in deeper trouble but for some sloppy catching by Bangladesh
Taskin Ahmed had De Leede caught behind for 17 to leave Netherlands teetering at 107 for five
Edwards soldiered on with Engelbrecht to score his second fifty of the tournament and 15th overall
Mustafizur snared Edwards with a wide yorker
Others: The result leaves the reigning champions England 10th and last in the standings.
